tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Director of Sales

Sales
US West Coast
Company: Bulletproof
Full Time

Overview

Bulletproof is an omni-channel content driven consumer products company. Our vision is to make high performance a daily reality for everyone by upgrading the earth’s coffee and food. Our mission is to help people perform better, think faster, and live better using a proven blend of ancient knowledge and new technologies, informed by science, and measured results from our customers. BP products help people live better by using fat for fuel, saying goodbye to sugar and supercharging mitochondria.

Bulletproof has a team of experienced entrepreneurs and biohackers working to make high performance a daily reality for everyone on the planet. While our culture is casual and our workplace flexible, everyone on the team is passionate, smart, focused and driven.

Our customers know that our coffee, beverages, food, and supplements are the purest you can get anywhere, and you can expect to feel a difference in how you perform the first time you experience them. Environmentally conscious and ethically sourced products build a sustainable foundation for future generations to thrive.

Position Overview:

Bulletproof is looking for a in the, flexibility on location as this will be a high travel position between various retailers in this space.  This position is accountable for all selling aspects (promotional planning, forecasting, distribution, new item sell-in, presentations, execution of marketing and promotions, etc.) at assigned Grocery/other account headquarters.  S/he will have deep experience and relationships with customers, with a track record of success in Grocery Channels. S/he will be a results oriented, collaborative thinker with strong business planning, excellent communication, and strategic selling skills.  The successful candidate will be entrepreneurial, innovative, and excel at disruptive thinking. Defining and implementing long term business strategies based on trends and competitive analysis and the ability to think outside of the box to solve complex problems are critical to success. S/he will have analytical horsepower, excellent business judgment, strong operational skills, and a passion for creating a world class brand experience for Bulletproof customers. S/he must enjoy a fast pace and operating at all levels of the organization.

Director of Grocery/Other  US Market

Key Responsibilities:
  • At assigned accounts, develop and execute channel and account sales strategies that align with Bulletproof Sr. Leadership. Customers will include: Kroger, Alb/Swy, Publix and other regional chains. It may also include other Drug/Vitamin customers.
  • Achieve top and bottom line budget goals
  • Strategic direction of the customer relationship
  • Accountable for direct sales management with assigned customers (all sales calls, line reviews, strategy meetings, etc.). Eventually this will be more of a Team Leadership position, with Regional Sales Managers and Brokers to manage as the business expands.
  • Build sustainable partnerships with key decision-makers and teams at assigned accounts
  • Proactively team/partner with internal Bulletproof resources across multiple functions (finance, marketing, product management, etc.) that influence and help with execution of the Club and Mass Channel strategy, to lead plan development, selling activities and forecasting to maximize performance.
  • Manage promotional processes from the planning stage, to development to execution, ensuring all retailer timelines are met, deliverables are executed, and communication is timely to internal parties and the retailer.
  • Investment Strategy: Maximize and execute trade budgets against promotional plans/calendars to deliver optimal margin
  • Work Collaboratively with Broker if applicable, motivating and directing brokers to help achieve account goals
  • Plan and conduct regular business reviews with BP’s Executive Leadership

    • Basic Qualifications:
    • Minimum 10 years of demonstrated success with CPG sales
    • Demonstrated Success with Key Accounts
    • Demonstrated ability to operate both strategically and tactically in a high-energy, fast-paced environment.
    • Proven track record of success defining and delivering innovative disruptive ideas to drive long term business results.
    • Experience working with partners at multiple levels within the organization (operations, category/marketing, supply chain, finance, human resources, legal and other functional groups)
    • High degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
    • Excellent communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills that enable you to earn trust at all levels.
    • Bring a reputation of high integrity
    • Bachelor’s Degree Required

      • Preferred qualifications:
      • Demonstrated Success Selling Innovative, Healthy/Functional and/or Coffee/Cold Brew Ready -to-Drink Beverage products across Channels
      • Demonstrated Success pioneering with early stage, innovative brands in fast-paced, high growth CPG company

        • Professional traits that are not unique to this position, but necessary for Bulletproof:
        • Team player
        • Natural self-starter
        • Exhibits excellent judgment
        • Entrepreneurial problem solver
        • Self-aware and curious
        • Has relentlessly high standards
        • Thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical execution
        • Has the innate ability to inspire passion in others

          • Maximum fun, maximum knowledge, and maximum performance are a part of the job description, and you’ll get to work with the Bulletproof team on a regular basis to upgrade your game, your mental performance, and your life.  This is a great opportunity to grow with a dynamic, entrepreneurial company.

          Think you’ve got what it takes?

          Let’s talk!

          To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://jobs.jobvite.com/bulletproof/job/owP17fwd →

items.title: SEO Sales Executive / Account Manager
items.content:
About Us

Design Your Way LTD is a digital marketing and lead generation startup company. Specifically, our main speciality are high ticket items in Building and Construction projects, but we also operate with smaller industries also. We have a small amount of websites generating leads, however the average value of each lead for the larger assets between £15,000 - £200,000 dependent on project, making the potential profits larger than anticipated. We are now looking to extend the SEO branch of our company, and looking to hire a full time sales executive to outreach for SEO clients.

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced, extremely confident and innovative SEO Sales Executive who can both prospect and sell SEO services to companies in local areas around the United Kingdom. Many of the clients we are aiming for will be local to either borough (London) or city, and the niches will be discussed. We will also need someone who is capable of working from home, as we do not work within an office.

The right salesperson will be able to prospect all potential and future clients, while offering a clients a monthly payment scheme. The candidate will also be able to ensure that all relationships will grow and maintained throughout time, with hopefully some room for negotiation upon cost in the future, however this is not a necessity. Finally, the right candidate will be able to keep in communication with clients during their active status with us. We are not offering a salary for this role, but we are offering 20% of all future profits that you have generated, while the client is still active, even if you leave us. We are also offering you the chance to work remotely.

This role is ideal for anyone looking to earn an extra income working remotely and equally suited to someone with precious sales experience that prefers working on a flexible or freelance basis.

Responsibilities

* Prospect, identify and secure new SEO Clients.

* Maintain and grow relationships between us and SEO clients.

* Negotiate a contract between us and clients that are beneficial for both.

* Able to report all improvements in website rank in keywords, loading times and other significant ranking factors.

* Able to work 2 - 3 days a week.

* Have a clear and concise strategy to secure clients within a suitable time frame.

Skills & Knowledge

* Experience outreaching for and acquiring SEO clients.

* Confidence approaching businesses via calls, e-mail and face to face if necessary.

* Self-motivating and passion for SEO sales.

* Disciplined and targeted sales approach.

* Desire to exceed beyond expectations.

* Confident to reflect and adapt sales approaches both through phone and e-mail.

Benefits

* 20% ongoing profits that you have generated (paid even if you leave us!) and 25% bonus based on performance and speed of client acquisition.

* Remote working.

* Small amount of total clients needed (10 to begin) means very small workload.

* Flexible working hours.

* Opportunity to stay on during future expansion on an improved deal based on performance.

We move fast, constantly improve our products and ship code multiple times a day. Everyone here is passionate about the problems they are solving and collaborate to make that happen

Some of the benefits of working at Muck Rack include:
- Muck Rack is funded by our customers, not venture capitalists.
- Big decisions are made by our team, not a board of directors.
- We're a remote first company. Work wherever you're at your best.
- We want you to feel ownership and excitement about what you’re building, and as a part of a small startup you’ll have a lot of influence to shape the company and engineering direction overall.
- 401k and health insurance for eligible employees

LOCATION
We have an office in SoHo, NY. You can work there, remotely from home, a café, or wherever you're at your best.

TECH STACK
Python, Django, Celery, Sass, Redis, Memcached, Solr, Nginx, Gunicorn, Varnish, Ansible, Github, Linode

SALARY RANGE DOES NOT INCLUDE BONUS POTENTIAL :)!

Muck Rack is looking for an ambitious individual who is looking to enter the world of sales at one of the fastest growing tech startups in NYC. Muck Rack's mission is to make journalists, PR pros and marketers more successful by providing the technology to do so. This includes helping media professionals find journalists to pitch and monitor on a day to day basis via Muck Rack Pro, our advanced service.

Muck Rack is looking for an Account Executive to take ownership over their footprint among Fortune 500 companies and large PR agencies across the world. This position will work closely with the Senior Vice President responsible for sales.

Dubai, Remote · Full Time
Our mission is to make the world a better place through education.Read More

Our mission is to make the world a better place through education.

How?

Our vision is to improve accessibility through modern technology.

Your mission, if you choose to accept it, is to help us create the next big thing. Help us shake up the scene using your strengths and bring new ideas to the table.

We are a dynamic young startup based out of Dubai, looking to grow the family. Be a part of this exciting phase and grow something that is growing fast.

About the team: We are result driven, value being practical, our work environment is flexible, and we are all very ambitious. Are you someone who wants to create something amazing, be empowered and are hands on?

Who we are? At Teach Me Now, we are an international mix that have passions for things like rollerblading, argentine tango, intellectual debates and indulging in amazing food at the office.

We are looking for people who dare to be different and want to be a part of something that help change the way the world learns.

Job Description

Are you amazing at sales and looking for a new opportunity with big incentives? Are you result oriented?

We are looking to hire a passionate sales executive with experience in either educational or technology sales.

You will be building relationships with key partners and selling an educational software solution that is growing globally and helping thousands of students have access to education on a daily basis.

We are looking for someone with an eye for sales, passion for education/tech and an international approach.

We are a growing dynamic and international team looking for the right people to make things happen. Do you have what it takes?

Functional Role:

- Sell educational products to schools, governments, institutes and HR departments.

- Implement marketing and promotion strategy to the identified key operators to promote Teach Me Now as a software-as-a-service solution to further advance the teaching and learning process of schools, institutions and governments;

- Continuously improve marketing and and sales strategies;

- Coordinate with set up of new customers;

Required Skills / Experience:

- You must be fluent in English

- Background in education and technology sales

- Result driven and a proven track record of targets

- Full of initiative

- Knowledge and experience of sales and marketing strategy

- Strategic Thinking and planning skills

- Presentation Skills/ Good at Public Speaking

Apply with your cv and cover letter to hr@teachmenow.com today.

Creating educational software and at the same time hosting a global marketplace for one to one learning - where anyone can teach and everyone can learn.

Teach Me Now is our public facing website and marketplace, where we have teachers/ tutors and students learning around the world. The goal is:

items.content:
One in five households in the UK live in social housing, a sector with the right values at its core but that has historically struggled to deploy innovations in the home. Many residents still can’t afford to heat their homes and live in cold, mouldy properties they can’t be proud of. At Switchee, we believe that everyone deserves to live in a decent home and that the environments we inhabit have a massive influence on our ability to enjoy life and prosper.

We may be only three years old, but it’s already been quite a ride! Our first product, the internet connected Switchee thermostat is already in 35 of the biggest housing providers in the UK. We’re growing 100% year on year and are backed by some of the best-known investors in technology and social impact.

To strengthen our small team of 15 passionate and ambitious people we are looking for an outstanding individual to join us as

*Customer* *Account* *Manager*

We are driven by a collective desire to make a positive impact in the housing sector, both for residents and landlords, so your commitment to our values and mission are paramount.

*Your* *responsibilities*

As Customer Account Manager you will be responsible for all Switchee’s interactions with our most important Housing Association and Local Authority customers. You will co-ordinate the various touchpoints the Switchee team has with each customer, typically taking ownership from sales and working with our operations, development, marketing and leadership teams. Your ultimate responsibility will be the successful delivery of Switchee services to our large, complex landlord customers with the aim of building long-term (multi-year) commercial relationships based on trust. As we continue to develop our technology an important part of this role will be to develop a deep understanding of both our customers’ and end users needs so that you can input into Switchee product development.

Being more specific, you will:

* Be the main point of contact with up to 20 Switchee Customers
* Co-ordinate and oversee communication with each customer from various parts of the Switchee team; ensure that all deliverables are met on time
* Actively seek and grow relationships with all parts of each customer organization, focusing on relevant decision makers
* Pro-actively develop a deep understanding of customer and resident needs and how Switchee can either solve them today or develop solutions and/or commercial partnerships to solve them in the future
* Monitor and proactively grow the usage of Switchee data insights by all parts of a customer organisation
* Suggest and present new product features to our development team, demonstrating a clear understanding of customer value and the need for ROI
* Be constantly aware of the need to deliver customer and resident value and to measure and objectively report on this to a range of stakeholders
* Be aware that successful implementation of Switchee’s technology does not stop at the delivery of a dashboard, but will ultimately require changed customer behaviour (for example the switch from reactive to pro-active maintenance)
* Understand that blockers may be cultural/behavioural as well as technical and thrive in finding solutions to these
* Contribute to the growth of Switchee by building long-term commercial relationships with each customer


We are a company built on a strong technical foundation. You’ll need to grasp and communicate a technical solution with clients. We also expect you to work closely with Product Development to ensure our product evolves with the customer’s needs at the very centre.



*Your* *experience*

We firmly believe extraordinary people can come from a wide range of places – but we wouldn’t be surprised if the person who gets this role has:

* At least 3 years’ experience in management consultancy or a similar commercial field
* Bachelor’s degree from a top university
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Proven ability to develop and implement effective solutions to complex commercial problems
* Strong analytical & numeracy skills with complete command of Excel
* Fluency with large data sets and an ability to interrogate them for commercial insight
* Comfort talking in detail about the technology and processes required to manage large customer accounts
* B2B customer facing experience preferred
* Experience in a small & quickly expanding business
*Knowledge of the housing sector
* Experience working with Internet of Things devices


*You*

We are a diverse bunch of people at Switchee. That said, there are some characteristics we always look for:

* You deeply care about Switchee’s mission; you have a desire to build something revolutionary, that will disrupt an industry, and positively impact ordinary people’s lives.
* You care about the environment, are interested in energy efficiency and have thought about the challenges and opportunities posed by an evolving domestic energy market
* You like technology and neat solutions to complex problems
* You thrive on challenge and change; you naturally gravitate to the hardest questions first and love thinking differently to solve them.
* You are biased towards action and you’re happiest when you’re ‘getting stuff done’.
* You’re open, positive & straightforward. You’re not afraid to stand up for your convictions, even when it’s hard to do so.
* You delight in your colleagues’ successes and thrive on your failures; you grasp any opportunity for learning and constantly seek to improve.


*Our* *mission*

We believe that radical innovation in internet connected technology can ensure that every resident, every day, is living in a home that allows them to succeed. That’s why our products are built not just on great technology, but on an understanding of what people want from the space they live in.

This approach led us to reimagine the most mundane household object, a thermostat, into a product that automagically reduces energy bills, looks great and offers control to those who want it.

We are also revolutionising the way social landlords manage their housing stock with an obsessively tailored SAAS property dashboard and handy alerts on things like when the boiler is going to break.

Our next project is to build the ultimate connected hub for the social home. It’s going to revolutionise the way residents interact with their properties and landlords manage their homes.

*Life* *at* *Switchee*

We like to keep things simple and flexible at Switchee and consider you to be joining our family. We don’t currently track holidays so you’re free to take as much as you need. We occasionally work remotely but are sensitive to the needs of our colleagues.

We socialise together with regular outings in London and an annual “working remotely” trip where you have the option (but not obligation) to join us in working from a fun location.

If we end up working together, we can offer a competitive salary and a generous stake in the company.

If you believe in the same things, don’t hesitate any longer, apply now! Please be in touch soon as we’ll proceed once the right person is found. If you’d like to apply please submit a CV and cover letter on our Careers page.

items.content:
We are Resi. The straight-forward modern architect.


We believe in making world-class residential architecture accessible to all. Through our use of technology, we can offer a high quality and cost-effective service right across the UK.


Working here, you’ll discover that we do things a little differently to our competitors. We’re looking to shake up the architecture industry and so need an ambitious, no-holds-barred team to make this happen.


We have a fun, dynamic team, located in Bermondsey (though we’re moving to Elephant & Castle soon). Currently, we’re a small team of under 30, but we’re growing quickly and on the hunt for someone with a bit of hustle to join our business development team. Nope not cold calling. You help answer questions that homeowners might have before they commission us to undertake their project.


Most companies say they are an equal opportunities employer, but we really mean it. We are led by a female CEO and a female CTO. We actively encourage people who feel like they don’t fit the traditional stereotypes to apply. Your experience is all that matters.


Experience
• Likes helping people and talking
• Can hustle or put differently, can build rapport with people – we don’t like the hard sell
• 1-2 years sales experience (in any setting)
• Can write well
• Is diligent and hardworking
• Has a thirst for knowledge and picks things up quickly


Desirable but not essential:
• Has studied architecture (or even incomplete) or some form of construction experience
• Understands or has experience working on a building site, the lifecycle of a house extension (maybe you have done one) in an architecture firm or as a supplier (could be flooring / glazing / kitchens)


What we offer:
• A good London-based salary
• Commission
• The opportunity for rapid progress
• Ownership of your work & area
• On the job training
• 30 days holiday (inc Bank Holidays)
• The chance to help build a company from the ground up


All applications should include a CV and a cover letter/email as to why you think you would be a good fit for Resi

items.title: Social Media Manager
items.content:
Social Media Manager

Location: Remote Moscow
Role and job type: Marketing Full-time

Job Description

Akropolis is looking for a Social Media Manager to join our ambitious and highly motivated team. Brand Marketing will be transformational for the future of Akropolis and you will play a pivotal role in this. This position requires a high level of creativity, as well as the ability to use data-driven insights and other team member inputs to produce relevant material.

Akropolis has grown rapidly over the past few months and we are looking for someone who will be responsible for community building and growth across all social media channels. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record in managing Social Media in the crypto sphere.

Daily Operations:

  • Represent our brand on social media channels;
  • Deliver engaging and inspiring messages to our social audiences, with the goal of driving brand awareness and consideration;
  • Significantly grow our audience on social media;
  • Define and implement paid and organic growth strategies;
  • Turn our high level marketing strategy into a social media strategy and calendar;
  • Prioritize between channels, posts and messages;
  • Work together with influencers, internal, and external creative teams to build social content that engages and inspires large customer audiences;
  • Scale our social content across multiple markets and languages;
  • Drive engagement with our social community;
  • Ensure communication excellence and convert audience feedback into reputation/brand-building moments;
  • Drive and develop customer understanding through insightful analyses and actionable reporting;
  • Work closely together with the other channel managers to drive a consistent and differentiated brand message to a mix of countries and audiences.

Previous experience/skills:

  • Min 1-3 years experience managing large scale social media channels;
  • Working experience in a blockchain startup is a plus;
  • Strong understanding of the social media landscape and crypto trends;
  • Ability to define a strategy across multiple channels and to operate within them;
  • Operational mastery of owned Twitter, Facebook and Linkedin channels. Experience in other channels (Telegram, YouTube, Reddit) is a plus;
  • Ability to define and execute on audience growth strategies through paid and organic campaigns;
  • Good ideas on how to make our brand stand out in a competitive Fintech landscape.
  • Experience briefing and cooperating with creative teams in order to produce outstanding messaging;
  • You stay up-to-date on the latest trends in social media. You’re a first mover and identify the underlying trends before they grow;
  • You know the ins and outs of how to successfully collaborate with influencers;
  • Strong analytical and reporting skills; able to use the right data and metrics to optimize performance; strong Excel skills and familiarity with Ads tools;
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced cross-functional environment. Understand how to align and motivate a variety of stakeholders and influence their priorities;
  • Clear communicator with excellent command of written and spoken English.

What we offer:

  • Working with an international team of world-class professionals with experience in finance, pensions, blockchain and crypto industries;
  • A fulfilling, challenging and flexible work experience;
  • Competitive salary, performance-based bonuses;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • You can work remotely or from our office in Moscow;
  • Practically unlimited professional and career growth opportunities.

Salary range

Competitive

items.content:
**** NO AGENCIES PLEASE****

Splento is an Amazon-like hybrid marketplace that controls the entire visual content creation, curation and distribution process from start to finish: from how you make your booking, to customer support, to photo editing, delivery, storage and sharing.

This is an opportunity for full-time Sales Manager to help grow and build our sales team. You’ll be working in a fast-paced environment, as part of a small sales team, reporting to Head of Growth.

The role is varied, with plenty of opportunities to learn. You will be dealing with existing clients, inbound leads and generating new leads, with focus on event managers and event agencies. You will responsible for the sale and managment of the accounts.

The opportunity to grow is huge, and your salary will be topped up by incentives and commissions.

We are looking for:
– Experienced sales executives who want to take their game global
– Experience in events is a huge +
– Experience with Hubspot is a huge +, but training will be provided
– Good networking skills
– Excellent organisational & reporting skils
– Excellent command of the English language
– Strong written and verbal communication skills
– Time management skills and the ability to meet deadlines
– Someone interested in working in a fast-paced startup environment
– Eligible to work in the UK


Perks include:
– Free coffee and tea when in the office :)
– Flexible working hours and working remotely/from home is fine, but we prefer to have at least 4 days in the office.

tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Role Summary*

We have an exciting opportunity for a sales professional to join our team as an Account Executive. Your role will be working as a valuable member of our sales team managing relationships with our amazing partner accounting firms.

We're growing at an incredible rate and generating huge growth in the accounting channel. This is a perfect time to join Chaser and make an instant impact and contribution to the company's success.

Chaser Account Executives are at the heart of our sales and customer service offering. Taking a consultative approach to form strong relationships with our accounting partners, assisting and guiding them with cloud strategy.

As cloud accounting adoption keeps increasing within accounting firms, you will have the unique position to help support and increase their client portfolio by adopting Chaser into their firms. You can truly help them become more efficient, add real value to their clients and help them become that go digital accounting firm they strive to become.

You'll be reporting directly to the Head of Partner Channel Sales. Our head office is located in Moorgate London; however, we do offer remote working for the right candidate.

*As a person you:*

* Have highly developed communication skills and a positive demeanour
* Are consultative, process driven and persistent, with excellent professional written and verbal communication skills
* Hard working but like to have fun and come to work with a smile on your face
* You will be extremely ambitious
* You will be someone who thrives in a high speed environment
* Digitally proficient, you will be excited to build an understanding of how best to use Chaser as a product. This will be essential for your success in the role

*What your role will consist of*

* Building a deep understanding of accounting and bookkeeping firms
* Acting as a trusted advisor to our accounting and bookkeeping partners and supporting change management in their firms
* Educating partners to help maximise growth
* Managing and respond to incoming partner enquiries
* Monitoring all existing and prospective partners progress through the sales funnel
* Maintaining and update the CRM system of all partners staff and contact details, alongside adding new partner enquiries
* Creating and running webinars
* Providing both online and onsite demos of Chaser

*Why you'll love Chaser*

At Chaser we value our people, we want them to enjoy the job they do and provide opportunities to love and grow their career. An exciting growing company we attract people who want to help us have a positive impact by helping our partner and their clients thrive and be successful. Our passionate, innovative Chaser team strive every day to make a meaningful impact. At Chaser, we truly value the input of every single member of the team. If successful, you'll be joining a sharp, welcoming group of people who will help you learn new skills and develop as an individual.

*Benefits*

* Competitive salary
* Share options
* Company pension scheme
* 25 days holiday
* Flexible working hours

If you're looking for a role that is exciting, challenging and diverse in which you can form lasting business and personal relationships, apply for the Chaser Account Executive position today.

*How to apply*

In applying, please answer the following questions:

# Why have you applied for this role?
# What is your proudest professional or academic achievement and why? - ( Max 200 words)
# Are you eligible to work in the UK?

items.title: Student or Graduate Sales Exec position
items.content:
Driven Media is a Truck and HGV advertising specialists. We utilise the valuable but often unused space on the side of trucks, and rent it to run campaigns for our clients and advertisers.

Following our appearance on Dragons Den, and successful investment at the start of this year, we are now looking to expand our remote sales team and take on 2 or 3 current students or recent graduates who want to make a name for themselves.

The role involves marketing your respective geographical areas, and utilising the contacts and companies at your disposal in order to get our brand name out into the market place. You will be tasked with landing 3/6/ 12 month campaigns and will receive a healthy commission percentage in return. We are also offering initial and ongoing training, a Sales Buddy to guide and support you with your clients, and will support you with generating inbound leads, marketing and how get the best form your sales efforts.

In addition to a healthy 10% commission per campaign (average client campaign being worth £8,000), you can also benefit from a lucrative 'fast start' bonus, which rewards those team members who hit the ground running, and have the passion and stamina to succeed in the highly competitive market that is advertising space. This bonus scheme could be with up to £3,200 extra within your first 6 months!

So if you are a fast self-starter, wanting to make a name for yourself in sales and marketing, love negotiation and closing deals, and want to earn uncapped commission to subsidise your studies, please apply below and lets start a conversation.

Every relationship has to start somewhere, and this could be your next big opportunity.

items.content:
CargoMate Technologies is focused on bringing innovative efficiency to the container shipping industry. We are well funded and backed by one of the UK’s most successful tech accelerators, Entrepreneur First.
We’re developing a range of applications and technologies to record, monitor and analyse container ship cargo operations (i.e. the process of moving containers on and off a ship in port), to ensure ships depart early and consume less fuel on a voyage. Our long-term goal is to bring the widespread adoption of autonomous technologies to merchant ships.

We’re looking for tenacious Sales Development Reps to join our team and help us take our groundbreaking technology to market.

What you’ll do:

- Identify and qualify sales opportunities for CargoMate
- Become an expert in container ship operations and the maritime industry
- Work closely with the Head of Growth and your dedicated Account Executive to identify ongoing strategic target accounts
- Research prospect clients and prepare reports that give your Account Executives everything they need when they go for meetings
- Religiously update Hubspot, our CRM, to stay current on leads and follow-ups
- Shadow your Account Executive at meetings to learn the skills you need to take the next step in your career

What we want:

- A bachelor's degree, or equivalent professional experience
- 1 - 3 years work experience in sales, business development, customer success, or consulting; ideally within technology, SaaS, or shipping and logistics.
- Outstanding communication, interpersonal skills, organisational skills. You should be a great writer, speaker, and most importantly listener.
- Tenacity and fearlessness - you should be willing to speak on the phone with new people every single day to explain CargoMate’s value proposition.
- An obsession with prospect happiness - you need to set the stage for effective follow up conversations and meetings.
- Flexibility - we’re constantly changing and evolving as a team and we want people who are willing to evolve with us
- The ability to challenge the status quo and continuously improve the way we work
- The ability to travel internationally and the desire to work with an international client base
- The intelligence to quickly become an expert in maritime operations, our technology, and sales; and the curiosity to continuously learn about the space as it develops.

What you’ll get:

- A competitive salary plus OTE.
- Support, mentoring, and the tools you need to become world class at what you do.
- The chance to join an early stage business and shape its future.
- A structured path to promotion, with the opportunity to lead a team or become a principle individual contributor as we scale
- The flexibility to work when you want to, and opportunity to undertake remote work once you’ve completed your first few months on the team

If you'd like to apply to this role, please get the attention of Nick Chubb (our Head of Growth) in the most creative way possible.

items.content:
Team Assistant / Office Manager // SmartRecruiters

Company: SmartRecruiters

Tags:
  • Office Management
  • executive assistance
  • Legal Assistant

    • SmartRecruiters understands that people are the heart of an organization. That’s why we’ve built our modern Talent Acquisition Platform to help companies hire the best! As the hiring success company, we enjoy a collaborative office environment that’s casual and dog-friendly. We understand that working hard means you should play hard too, that’s why we offer competitive salaries and strong career progression opportunities.

    Job Description
    SmartRecruiters is looking for a Team Assistant / Office Manager to help keep our team and office running STRONG. This is an excellent opportunity for a sharp and engaging individual to bring their superior organizational skills, experience managing internal business administrative tasks, and amazing personality to a rapidly growing company.

    This role is perfect for someone who is excited to support a quickly growing Internet startup with a lot of energy. You should enjoy being busy and working on a variety of projects because you’ll be working in a fast-paced, creative environment where the challenges are always changing.

    Looking into the future, your responsibilities will expand as the company does – building and coordinating a larger staff, incorporating new processes and applications to the company, the sky’s the limit!

    As soon as you land at SmartRecruiters we’ll be looking for your support in:

    Executive Assistance

    • Assist our executives in their daily business to make them more effective
    • Manage the office budget

    Legal Assistance

    • Draft, proofread, format correspondence and documents (in English / German)
    • File paperwork and keep documents organised

    Office Management

    • Make the office an awesome place to work!
    • Help plan and execute company events, team outings, holiday parties, and other fun activities
    • Coordinate our service providers
    • Manage procurement of office supplies and equipment
    • Work with colleagues across our other offices in San Francisco, Krakow, London, Spokane, and Paris

    Qualifications

    • Fluent and professional German and English
    • Solid experience from similar roles, ideally in a startup environment
    • Familiarity with contracts and law is a plus
    • Proficient in MS Office and Google Suite tools (Gmail, Calendar, Google Docs, etc.)
    • Experience with basic HR related functions
    • Excellent planning and time management skills and ability to work with minimal supervision
    • Exceptionally well organized, honest, and reliable
    • High attention to detail and strong problem solving skills
    • Curiosity around recruitment and the HR technology sector

    Join our team

    You will join us during arguably the most interesting stage of our company. This is an opportunity for you to take on full ownership of a key area and bring it to life. We’re an international team with members from Germany, USA, Sweden, Spain, Italy, Canada, Greece, France, Poland and Colombia. Our beautiful office is right on Hackescher Markt.

    FAQ:

    • Contract: Full-time
    • Starting date: As soon as possible
    • Location: Berlin Mitte
    • Salary: based on experience
    • Remote work possible: No

    SmartRecruiters has transformed the hiring process by reducing the stress that comes along with attracting, finding, engaging, and hiring new talent. Leading enterprises like IKEA, Visa, Marc Jacobs, and Square have abandoned their outdated Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS), for our all-in-one platform. What once started as a freemium product, has now turned into the world’s fastest growing enterprise solution.

    We are a fast growing, series C funded ($30M from Insight) start-up on a mission to IPO. If you’re looking to surround yourself with bright and passionate individuals that drive you to be your best – you’ve found the right place! Our transparent and entrepreneurial environment allows you to feel supported, grow your career, and have fun along the way. Everyone is encouraged to be the CEO of their job. This empowers individuals to own their role and have the confidence to explore and implement new ideas. SmartRecruiters believes in promotion from within, so high performance leads to upward mobility.

    Apply for this position

items.title: Rockstar Graduate Sales Honchos
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Rockstar Graduate Sales Honchos

We’re scouring London for Rockstar Sales Honchos who are talented, inspired and have a tenacious get-up-and-go attitude. Join our fun, fast-growing, early stage prop-tech start-up as a graduate Sales Honcho.

Your role

You’ll be boomeranging around London’s estate agencies, selling in-person, our cutting-edge technology software. The product is the industry-disrupting ‘Agency in a Box’ – which provides agencies with everything and anything they need to manage and grow their businesses. This includes 360° virtual property viewings, mobile apps, websites and entire back office software. All of this can be accessed remotely, anywhere in the world. We are constantly innovating; we are soon to roll out our virtual reality goggles and aerial drones.

We are facing unprecedented demand for our tech, and now is a perfect time to join an early-stage core team. £23k basic, plus uncapped commission which you earn with every sale.

You

• Get up and go attitude
• Enthusiasm
• Work-ethic
• A hunger to learn, improve and succeed
• Proactive
• Confident and fun
• Emotionally intelligent

We will support you to learn, develop and grow throughout this role – providing you with the foundations of a successful career in sales. No experience is necessary – we prioritise tenacity and diligence over everything else.

Show us what you’ve got in your two-month probation period and we’ll completely invest in you. You’ll be the head of a two/three-person appointment booking team that work for you to secure your appointments. You’ll then spend your days smashing them.

Our mission

The GNB was created in 2010 as a charity – set up to end homelessness through a global humanitarian platform. We wanted to fund this ourselves rather than rely on governments and donations… so we started our prop-tech start-up, GNB Properties, in 2016. Our mission is not profit motivated – it is exclusively social. We only exist to serve our mission.

Send us your CV and a short covering letter persuading us why you want to be a Sales Honcho. Our phone number is also below.

www.gnbproperty.com
02037 892 892

Curious to know more? Watch our 1-minute video!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5m3K8MvJTmQ

items.title: Client Services Account Manager
items.content:
Client Services Account Manager

Our unique London-based B2B prospecting service is looking to recruit an outgoing Client Services Account Manager. You’ll be responsible for taking the lead on the day to day client management, building rapport with both new and existing clients and working closely with the internal teams to deliver campaigns. You’ll hit the ground running digesting briefs, managing the copywriting and client onboarding processes. No 2 days will be the same so it’s important that you thrive in a fast-paced environment and have the ability to manage workload efficiently.

Founded in 2017, we are on a mission to provide best-in-class, white labelled, business
development services which translate into new sales opportunities for our clients.

To be considered, you must possess the following experience/skills.

-An expert listener - empathetic to the needs of our clients.
-Ideally, you’ll come with a few years’ experience working in a client facing role, ideally within sales and marketing.
-You’ll be highly organised with the ability to manage clients from a diverse workload.
-Commercial awareness, with the ability to manage and grow your accounts.
-You’ll have the ability to build relationships with ease and you’ll keep a cool head under pressure.
-A team player attitude, ready to roll up your sleeves and get stuck in.
-Able to build and develop long-term client relationships.
-A background in Business Development is desirable.
-A background in working for Start-ups.
-Comfortable working remotely.
-Proficient in Excel, Powerpoint, Word and the suite of Google cloud-based products.
- Familiar with using all Social Networking platforms - specifically LinkedIn
- A natural flair for marketing would be an advantage.
-Comfortable learning and working with online software packages.

This full-time position offers flexible and remote working conditions, however, you will be expected to travel to London on occasion for training and meetings.

Shrinking violets need not apply - we need a confident, self-motivated, proactive individual. We are a fast-paced, ever-changing start-up, and we need someone who comes up with ideas and isn’t afraid to share them! For the right person, we offer the opportunity to work for a modern, progressive company. You will have the ability to join us at a very exciting time of growth. Joining us from this early stage will allow you real scope for career progression, and you will be key to driving our continued success. We are looking for people that can inject new ideas and initiatives to support the ongoing growth and expansion of the business. Alongside a competitive salary, fun social events, employee discounts, and company pension scheme you’ll be joining a team of world-class experts in a Sales agency that offers outstanding training and progression.

As part of the interview process, you will be expected to clearly demonstrate how you managed the expectations of clients and resolved difficult challenges. You will also demonstrate how you went beyond the call of duty to support a client's need.

items.content:
We are looking for an BUSINESS STRATEGIST INTERN for a new coworking network in London. The right candidate must be able to manage the platform’s online marketing activities, such as monitoring the traffic on the website, creating search-engine friendly content, and create and manage digital marketing campaigns.

The right candidate:

The right candidate feels comfortable to work independently and have an entrepreneurial mindset. In addition, the applicant has a strong understanding of digital marketing.

Responsibilities:

- Producing and updating inspirational and high quality, search engine-friendly text content
- Search engine optimisation (SEO)
- Setting up and monitoring conversion tunnels and goals
- UX updates and split testing on site
- Monitoring online marketing activities and analysis of web traffic in Google Analytics
- Setting up and optimising Google AdWords campaigns
- Assisting with newsletters and social media related tasks
- Assisting with writing blog articles

About you:

- Have a genuine and passionate interest in
- A minimum of two up to five years of experience in online marketing or business analysis
- Extensive experience and knowledge of Google AdWords, Google Analytics, Facebook Ads, etc.
- Is an excellent writer and is able to communicate clearly and constructively
- Is self-driven, able to keep motivation high and get the job done on time, properly and consistently
- Able to work independently and remotely
- Creative and full of brilliant ideas
- Have an international marketing perspective
- Is IT-savvy and comfortable with various systems as your daily tools
- Has the ability to develop exciting and relevant content to engage the relevant target group
- Excellent English communication skills, both written and oral


If you wish to apply for this Online Marketing Specialist position, please send your CV, cover letter and some examples of what you have done in the past.

items.title: Business Development Executive
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Do you get excited at the prospect of meeting innovative software startups and scale ups in the UK? Do you have experience in talking to founders and directors and have a curiosity to find out more about their underlying technology advancements and funding challenges?

Do you want the freedom power and trust to do great work? This role could be for you.

GrantTree was founded 7.5 years ago and employs 35 people. As a company we're self-managing, we call this an open culture. It’s been successful for us so far, a rewarding and somewhat unusual working experience for self-motivated individuals (you should check out our GlassDoor reviews https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Reviews/GrantTree-Reviews-E855262.htm).

This is the ideal environment for creative, independent people who are open to developing through challenging work, and we're growing!

GrantTree are looking for a Business Development Executive to join the expanding sales team. We do well on conversion and retention and we're looking for an innovative self-motivated lead generating powerhouse to help build an even stronger pipeline.

Requirements:

Our Sales team is...

High-reaching
Brilliant at conversion
Formed of talented individuals each with their own creative way of building effective relationships.
If you could see yourself in our team please keep reading.

About you
You're a self starter with a keen interest in software and an existing network which ideally reflects this.
Your communication skills are expert level, whether you're at a networking event or qualifying on a phone call you strike the magic balance between giving and receiving information.
Sending emails, contacting prospects via LinkedIn, networking at events; your routes for finding and qualifying prospective clients is diverse and effective.
You’re a lifelong learner ready to apply your innate curiosity to how businesses operate and how they get funding.
You'll typically be the first point of contact and use your experience to lay the foundation for a strong client relationship.
You're a truly great teammate and get satisfaction from reporting on individual results as part of the sales teams targets.


This role is an exciting opportunity for someone with 2-3 years of new business experience who thrives on generating and managing a pipeline. We have talented people in our sales team who can transform your hot leads into tangible business, so you can spend more time meeting people and generating leads, your specialist area.

Benefits:

We believe that people should be rewarded fairly for the work they do. At GrantTree there is no secrecy over salaries and the way we work them out. For this role, this is likely to lie between £28k-£33k depending on experience.

Our sales team does not work on a commission basis, and this role is no exception. We focus instead on offering an attractive overall package. This way, you can to get involved in other important areas of the business (like inventing new products). You are also free to sell to the right people, in the right way. If commissions are important to you in staying motivated, this is not the role for you.

Aside from money, we offer a place where you can be yourself. We want you to develop your skills and fulfil your potential. We have a flexible approach to working, and some of our staff work remotely most of the time. Our office near Old Street is bright and airy, with a fab roof terrace. You can take up to 6 weeks as holiday each year.

Equal Opportunities
Teams are stronger when they have a diverse range of people. Applications are accepted from everyone, regardless of the categories they put themselves in. We also encourage talented ‘square pegs’, who don’t neatly fit into the person specification, to apply.

Are you excited by GrantTree but not sure about this role? Please feel free to send your CV to granttree@jobs.workablemail.com so we can contact you about future vacancies.

By applying, you're telling us you're OK with us processing your data for recruitment purposes only, according to the terms of our recruitment privacy policy.

items.title: Business Development & Sales Manager: North of England

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
*Summary*

Konnektis is on a mission to radically change the way care is delivered to people in their own homes, to place the person at the centre and ensure they receive the best care possible.

We are looking for an enthusiastic, passionate individual to join our team as a Customer Relationship Manager, who can have a significant impact in growing our customer base, whilst also managing existing relationships.

The right candidate will have experience making sales (ideally in the public sector), be ready to build relationships and networks within the ecosystem and be confident in moving discussions forward with C-level executives within Local Authorities and CCGs. They will be able to make sense of complex operational activities and have a genuine enthusiasm for leading on conversations about the future of the health and care sector.

Konnektis is operating with Local Authorities and Health Trusts/CCGs in the North of England and is funded to roll out its next stage of growth. This role will be based in the North of England.

We’re excited about our next stage of growth and want to continue to build our team of passionate individuals who are driven by the potential for technology to make an impact in the health and care sector.

*Responsibilities*

* Managing existing customers, prospective relationships and ecosystem relationships in the North of England

* Leading on customer research, identifying and qualifying leads and closing sales

* Working closely with the Founder CEO to secure, prepare and conduct sales meetings with Local Authorities and key stakeholders such as Health Trusts/CCGs

* Assisting in product design and roadmapping to ensure we are developing high impact functionality for customers and our end users, and handing over well developed project plans to our service delivery team

* Representing Konnektis at events and acting as an ambassador

*Requirements*

We’re looking for someone with:

* Commercial experience building relationships and selling to customers, ideally in the public sector and an ability to confidently engage with people at all levels of public sector organisations

* A genuine interest in the health and care sector and belief in the potential for technology to improve delivery in the sector

* A strong work ethic, who is independently driven and is able to work remotely

* Excellent oral, written and graphical presentation skills

* An ability to understand and explain the technical side of the Konnektis service

* An ability to understand health economics and the Konnektis value-add

*About us*

Konnektis believes in the power of technology to improve people’s lives in health and social care and combines this with a passion for putting people at the heart of everything we do.

The Konnektis digital platform transforms care delivery by providing an internet-enabled tablet device that replaces the paper records currently used in domiciliary and reablement care. It enables individuals in the care network to access, record and share information in real-time. In parallel, it enables the individual to use the tablet to engage in their own health and wellbeing to the fullest extent possible.

Konnektis aims to be the in-home platform of choice that records and shares the information that supports home care of older people, a growing multi-billion pound market driven by an ageing population and the need for integrated care services.

*Location and package*

* The role will be based in the North of England. Konnektis is currently based in Bradford and Manchester and can offer flexibility of work location for the right candidate

* The role will come with an attractive salary

*Apply by sending us your CV and a short email explaining why you want to join us.*

www.konnektis.com
